thread.title: Former USC coach Steve Sarkisian breaks silence during 'difficult time'
thread.title_full: Former USC coach Steve Sarkisian breaks silence during 'difficult time'

author: USA TODAY Sports
title: Former USC coach Steve Sarkisian breaks silence during 'difficult time'
text:
Two days after his dismissal from Southern California , former head coach Steve Sarkisian spoke publicly on Twitter, expressing gratitude for the support he's received during a "difficult time" and showing enthusiasm for the Trojans in their upcoming matchup against Notre Dame. "I wish my Trojans the best against Notre Dame and for the remainder of the season," Sarkisian tweeted Wednesday evening. "No one will be cheering them on more than me. Fight On!"
"I would like to thank everyone for their huge outpouring of support and well wishes," he said in his first series of tweets.
USA TODAY
Pat Haden defends himself in wake of Steve Sarkisian firing
He also tweeted: "This is a very difficult time for my family and me. I am facing these challenges the best I can and your support helps immensely."
The university originally put Sarkisian on an indefinite leave of absence after he failed to show up for Sunday's practice. The decision to terminate his contract came after further inquiries into the situation were made and athletics director Pat Haden determined that he was not "healthy."
USA TODAY
Steve Sarkisian's issues with alcohol started well before USC
Sarkisian was reprimanded and apologized in the preseason for appearing drunk at the "Salute to Troy" booster event in which Haden had to pull him off the stage during a speech.
Clay Helton has taken over as interim coach as the 3-2 Trojans face No. 13 Notre Dame on Saturday.
